  • Method Details

    • getUsersForEvent

      @GetMapping(path="/event/{eventId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getUsersForEvent(@PathVariable Integer eventId)
      This method gets a list of users assigned to an event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the event of the users.
      Returns:
      list of users assigned to the event in case of success, or a costume message error in case of failure.

    • getAllUser

      @GetMapping(path="/allUsers") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllUser()
      This method gets all users in the DB.
      Returns:
      list of users from the DB, or a costume message error in case of failure.

    • getUserByEmail

      @GetMapping(path="/email/{email}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getUserByEmail(@PathVariable String email)
      This method gets a user by hit email.
      Parameters:
      email - the user email is unique in the database.
      Returns:
      user with the required email, or a costume message error in case of failure.

    • getUserById

      @GetMapping(path="/id/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getUserById(@PathVariable Integer id)
      This method get a user from the DB.
      Parameters:
      id - the user required to fetch from the DB.
      Returns:
      user, or a costume message error in case of failure.

    • getUserById

      @GetMapping(path="/range") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getUserById(@RequestParam Map<String,String> map)
      This method gets all users that have an event between start date and time to end date and time. values: 'start' + 'end' are LocalDateTime variables which represent users with events in a range between start date and time to end date and time.
      Parameters:
      map - with keys & values of required operations.
      Returns:
      range of users with events between the requested values.

    • addUser

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addUser(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.User user)
      This method creates a new user.
      Parameters:
      user - the body of the user content.
      Returns:
      new user, or a costume message error in case of failure.

    • addListUsers

      @PostMapping(path="/list") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addListUsers(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.User> users) throws ajbc.doodle.calendar.daos.DaoException
      This method adds a list of users to the DB.
      Parameters:
      users - list containsUser objects with the body of the user content.
      Returns:
      a list of the added users, or a costume message error in case of failure.
      Throws:
      ajbc.doodle.calendar.daos.DaoException

    • subscribe

      @PostMapping("/login/{email}") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> subscribe(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.webpush.Subscription subscription, @PathVariable(required=false) String email)
      This method sends the subscription of a user.
      Parameters:
      subscription - the data from browser.
      email - the user email which trys to login.
      Returns:
      the email of the user.

    • unsubscribe

      @PostMapping("/logout/{email}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> unsubscribe(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.webpush.SubscriptionEndpoint subscription, @PathVariable(required=false) String email)
      This method logs out a user.
      Parameters:
      subscription - the user data.
      email - the logged user email.
      Returns:
      email of the user.

    • updateUser

      @PutMapping(path="/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateUser(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.User user, @PathVariable Integer id)
      This method updates a user by id.
      Parameters:
      user - the body of the object to update.
      id - the user id to update.
      Returns:
      the user after update.

    • updateListOfUsers

      @PutMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateListOfUsers(@RequestBody List<ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.User> users)
      This method updates a list of users.
      Parameters:
      users - is the list of objects to update.
      Returns:
      the updated list of users.

    • softDeleteUser

      @DeleteMapping(path="/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> softDeleteUser(@RequestParam Map<String,String> map, @PathVariable Integer id)
      This method deletes a user from DB. soft delete - set a flag for this user. hard delete - erase the user from the DB.
      Parameters:
      map - contains key and value of the required method type to delete.
      id - is the user id required to delete.
      Returns:
      the deleted user is case of success, or a costume message error in case of failure.
